column4: anyone try building the newer transmission on 8.10 and have any success? im having some issues regarding openssl, anyone have any insight/experience?
anyone try building the newer transmission on 8.10 and have any success? im having some issues regarding openssl, anyone have any insight/experience?
Have you tried using the PPA at https://launchpad.net/~transmissionbt/+archive , instead of building it?
had no idea a site like that existed, thanks man

no problem. FYI, apt-get will warn you about unauthenticated packages when you use PPAs; read the warning then decide whether or not you trust what is, essentially, packages made by some random person :)
i understand, thanks many my friend, btw quick n00b question, this reply i sent you, is it all red and stuff like how you sent me?
yes :)
excellent, unfortunatley the PPA failed
failed how, specifically?
i might not have a choice but to build @ this time!
broken dependency (cache) apparently im not sure what that means, but im gunna plug @ it 1 more time before i try building again
i win :)
gtk stuck around for some reason but everything else was removed so it messed up
Ah, that'd explain it. So the PPA ended up working?
or did you build it from source?
the PPA worked, thanks for the advice, btw is there anywere i can read more about these "PPA's" or even just what they stand for or are used for?
PPA stands for Personal Package Archive. They're basically little mini apt repositories that people use to upload unofficial packages they've built.
sweet great idea
Looks like there's more information about it at https://help.launchpad.net/Packaging/PPA?action=show&redirect=PPAQuickStart , though that may be a little technical.
exactly what im looking for, i may be a bit new to some things but, thats exactly how people learn, im not afraid of learning ;)
ask #vbox or ##windows. That sounds like a problem with your Windows guest, not the Ubuntu host.
